data.event: It was founded in 1833, and is the oldest city in Kane County, Illinois.

event.title: 2010 census, the city had a total population of 26,045, which was estimated

data.event: As of the 2010 census, the city had a total population of 26,045, which was estimated to have increased to 26,318 by July 2012.
Batavia was first settled in 1833 by Christopher Payne and his family.

event.title: was renamed by local judge and former Congressman Isaac Wilson in 1840

data.event: Originally called Big Woods for the wild growth throughout the settlement, the town was renamed by local judge and former Congressman Isaac Wilson in 1840 after his former home of Batavia, New York.
